page.title: 09FARMING _ LIVESTOCK + CROPS
page.content: Flocks of{sheep}(80-250 animals) are kept by 6 of the farms whilst {dairy, beef}and{breeding herds}(55-195 animals) are kept by all farms. The largest herd at Rill Farm contains 95 {Friesians,}yielding 500,000 litres of {milk}per year, 40 young{dairy cows}and 60 young beef cattle. Merryhue Park keep 100 "all grass{beef cattle"}and only 4 cows. All{milk}is sold to the Milk Marketing Board and all{lamb}and {beef}is sold at the live meat markets at Liskeard, Launceston, Redruth, or are slaughtered at local abattoirs (eg. Jaspers of Treburley). {Fodder crops}are grown on all farms and include{barley, wheat}and {corn}(all 2 tons/acre),{beet}(35 tons/ acre){silage}(20 tons/acre),{kale}and {hay. Rape}is grown as a dual purpose (fodder/oil) crop.{Potatoes}(12 tons/ acre) are a cash crop on 10 farms.
